trends: There have been 68 other sightings in Eugene
There were no other sightings in Eugene on or around September 28th 2008
Summary: 2 Orange balls moved closer to each other, intersected and one dropped fast and disappeared then other "dripped" small ones and vanished.
divs: sighting detailsmyself and two friends were walking within eugene's limits from one of our houses to another in a residential neighborhood. as we were talking, one buddy pointed ahead at two orange "dots\stars", in the sky. one was higher than the other and to it's right and both were moving slowly. the lower was moving to the right and the higher was moving down and to the left, towards the lower one. they had no blinking lights like a plane would, which is what caught our eyes... that and their bright orange color, as opposed to the stars we saw that were light yellow\white. they were both about the size of a large star and were shimmering a little. as the upper one came closer to the lower, they both began to accelerate (the upper one more so) and as they crossed each other's paths, the lower one "dropped" quickly toward the ground, as if it were "falling", dimmed on and off a little, then vanished. the upper one remained for about another three to five minutes, began to "drip" small orange lights, that were very faint and vanished like sparks cooling as they fall from being belched up from a campfire, then the large dot began to dim a little on and off like the other large one had, then it vanished. we had no idea what they could have been, and weren't very talkative about them after the incident was over. while we were watching them, we talked about them and whatever it was we were discussing at the time (small talk\forget what) about 66\34 percent of the time. it wasn't until they accelerated and passed each other that we became a little excited and as the one "fell" we walked a little faster to get past a street light we were approaching so we could see what it did as it neared the horizon. as the last one 'dripped', we were basically saying, "what the *bleep* could those possibly be?"
